messages.message: I’m at Citi trying to upload a bunch of files to instabase.com (http://instabase.com) and it was going fine, and now all of a sudden I’m having trouble. Even just single file uploads are hanging. Anyone know what could be going on?

- Are they very large?
- Are you uploading 100s at a time?
Actually they’re just taking a very very long time - I just uploaded a single 3MB file and it took 30+ seconds
Very large files can occasionally result in gateway timeouts. Too many files at a time I’ve seen have problems as well.
Ah, banks sometimes have very complicated firewall systems such that internet performance inside them is terrible.
But it was just working fine :(
For example, at Capital One SF, your traffic is first routed to Capital One Richmond before touching the internet, resulting in 1999-style internet
If it is a tremendous number of files, and you need a workaround, another option would be to create an S3 bucket that you then side-mount into instabase
But I’d avoid that unless you think using the web UI is being extra problematic
I was uploading about 50 per batch and that was taking about a minute each which wasn’t great but worked, and not all of a sudden it’s a lot slower
But yeah it could just be an internal Citizen thing
